resources.string: IELTS Juice
How long is the consultation?
You will receive a 20-minute consultation. Make sure you go online at least five minutes before it starts.
Where is the consultation held?
On Skype. No matter where you are, you can use a smartphone or preferably a laptop to attend.
What happens during the consultation?
The session starts with an oral placement test. Then we give you a study plan and advice on how to prepare for IELTS. You can also ask your own questions.
Is this consultation really free?
Absolutely! If you are serious about your learning, we are happy to show your the roadmap. (This service is free until further notice.)
Can I book a consultation more than once?
Sorry, but you can use this free service once only. If you need to meet with our consultants a second time or need an online lesson, please book a session for a small fee.
Is a high speed Internet connection necessary?
Yes. You will be in an audio and/or video call with your teacher, so you’ll need a good Internet connection, but today in most parts of the world, the speed is even higher than needed.
How long are the courses?
They are of different lengths, but you can progress faster or slower depending on your personal speed. Most students finish each skill in a few weeks.
Will I have a teacher?
Yes and no. An experienced British Council IELTS expert teaches you in pre-recorded videos that you can watch anytime, anywhere. No live lessons.
Who are your courses for?
IELTS preparation courses are recommended to English learners of B2 level or higher.
How many days/hours do I have to study?
You can study any time of the day and as often as you want based on your lifestyle or needs, but we recommend at least 3 hours of practice each day.
Will I need any books to study during the online course?
The course materials are more than enough for learning the techniques and strategies. But you definitely need to use the books recommended in the courses for test practice.
What if I have a question?
No worries! Every course has its own question and answer forum where you can get help from our IELTS experts and other students in the course.

Welcome to the Speaking module of the IELTS Juice Online Academy. The course consists of 10 chapters with hours of videos, interactive exercises, downloads, further study recommendations. There is also a speaking forum where you can discuss your questions with teachers and other learners.\n"We start off by looking at the test layout, watch an interview recorded at the IELTS Juice studio, and later, we will practice the features of each part. During the course, you will be able to test yourself using lots of interactive exercises.
As you just learned from the video lesson, the Academic and General Training modules of IELTS are the same in the Speaking part.
In this part of the academy, you will watch a complete model of the IELTS Speaking test conducted at the IELTS Juice studio. Let’s start with part 1.

Watch the recording again. Only this time, just let the examiner speak and mute or pause when the candidate answers the questions. Keep your recorded voice with you throughout the course. This will help you have a tangible feeling of your progress.
This is a model IELTS Speaking test part 2 conducted at the IELTS Juice studio. Watch it carefully and see how the interviewer gives the question card and asks the candidate to return it.

Look at the card below (from the video lesson) and prepare your answers. Even better, keep your notes and your recorded voice for this card with you throughout the course. Later on, this will help you have insights into how well you could have improved your performance.

Describe you like or admire. 
You should say: 
 ✓ who this person is 
 ✓ what this person has done 
 ✓ why this person is well-known 
 ✓ and explain why you admire this person.
This is a model IELTS speaking test part 3 conducted at the IELTS Juice studio. Watch it carefully.

Watch the recording again. Only this time, just let the examiner speak and mute or pause when the candidate answers the questions. Keep your recorded voice with you throughout the course. This will help you have a tangible feeling of your progress. Remember! For this part, you should speak at length and expect follow-up questions from the examiner, so be prepared.
